Key Match Events: Ireland got off to a quick start, thanks to Ross Adair, but they kept losing wicket at regular intervals once he slipped out
Curtis Campher's 49 gave them some boost
South Africa were off to a flier. Ryan Rickelton and Reeza Hendricks set the tone early, launching an aggressive assault during the Powerplay
Ryan Rickelton recorded a brilliant half-century
Ireland, desperate for a breakthrough, found hope when Craig Young delivered a top ball to dismiss Hendricks
Aiden Markram and Matthew Breetzke comfortably guided their side home with 14 balls to spare
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling, the captain of Ireland, mentioned that the team had been targeting a score of around 190-200 but lost their way after the 15-over mark
Aiden Markram, the skipper of South Africa, expressed his satisfaction with the win, especially during challenging times for the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match promises thrilling cricket action, with power hitters and skilled bowlers on both sides
